intro: Odontocarya diplobotrya, commonly known as the double-lobed sandwort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Montiaceae and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant features small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in early summer, typically arranged in clusters. Its leaves are succulent and fleshy, adapted to retain moisture in arid environments. Odontocarya diplobotrya is often found in rocky soils and is well-suited to high-altitude ecosystems.
